Sentence: Extrapolating to 0 K, we find an H c2 (0) of 10.6 T, lower than what is typically found for MgB 2 films on metal substrates-e.g. 15.3 T on Cu [18], 15.2 T on SS [20] and 13.5 T on Mo .
Two hemispherical cavities (one Cu, one Nb-coated Cu) are utilized in the system, with 2 inch samples mounted on the flat surface of the cavities.
T c of the MgB 2 film, which determined by measuring where Q flattens out at high temperature, is about 39 K and consistent with the average value from our DC R-T analysis.
